channel.title: Reg players dont lose things when they die?
channel.description: ok..my regualr players don't lose things when they die, example like.. they're in pvp and they die, they dont lose their stuff or if they die to a(n) NPC they dont lose their things, just like admin+ doesnt.. how do i fix this?

item.title: Reg players dont lose things when they die?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

The last time I used an allstar base, I didn’t even know what a boolean was.

Read full topic

item.title: Reg players dont lose things when they die?
item.dc:creator: @ug1yw4t3rm3l0n ug1yw4t3rm3l0n
item.description:
@ug1yw4t3rm3l0n wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:18, topic:364695”]Well, since players aren’t losing items, I guess the method doesn’t exist.

Here it is

[code=Java] public void youdied() {
if (playerHasItem(5509)) {
deleteItem(5509, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(5510)) {
deleteItem(5510, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(5512)) {
deleteItem(5512, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(5514)) {
deleteItem(5514, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(6570)) {
keep6570 = true;
deleteItem(6570, 1);
}
if (!isSkulled) {
keepItemHandle();
}
if (ProtItem) {
applyProtectItemProt();
}
for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
try {
if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 11999) { // createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
replaceBarrows();
// server.checkPlayerCapes.checkDrop(this);
ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
// createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY,
// playerItemsN[i]);
deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]);

            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
        }
    }
    for (int r = 0; r < playerEquipment.length; r++) {
        try {
            int item = playerEquipment[r];
            if ((item > 0) && (item < 11999)) {
                remove(item, r);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sM("ERROR: Removing Equipment");
        }
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5509)) {
        deleteItem(5509, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5510)) {
        deleteItem(5510, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5512)) {
        deleteItem(5512, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5514)) {
        deleteItem(5514, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(6570)) {
        keep6570 = true;
        deleteItem(6570, 1);
    }
    for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
        try {
            if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 11999) {
                // createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
                replaceBarrows();
                // server.checkPlayerCapes.checkDrop(this);
                ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
                        playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
                // createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY,
                // playerItemsN[i]);
                deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
                        getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
        }
    }
    try {

    } catch (Exception e) {
    }
    ItemHandler.addItem(526, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false);
    try {
    } catch (Exception e) {
    }
    if (itemKept1 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept1, 1);
    if (itemKept2 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept2, 1);
    if (itemKept3 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept3, 1);
    if (itemKept4 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept4, 1);
    if (keep6570) {
        addItem(6570, 1);
        keep6570 = false;
    }

    resetKeepItem();
    hitDiff = 0;
    updateRequired = true;
    appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}[/code]

And add this into boolean process:

if (!IsInFightCave() && !isInPitGame() && !isInPitRoom() && deathStage == 2 && System.currentTimeMillis() - deathTimer >= 2000) { client killerz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[KillerId]; youdied(); killerz.sM("You have defeated " + playerName); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }[/quote]
I have that in my allstar source, but when admin die they lose their stuff, What do i need to add to prevent admins from losing their items.

Read full topic
item.source: Reg players dont lose things when they die?

item.title: Reg players dont lose things when they die?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Well, since players aren’t losing items, I guess the method doesn’t exist.

Here it is

[code=Java] public void youdied() {
if (playerHasItem(5509)) {
deleteItem(5509, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(5510)) {
deleteItem(5510, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(5512)) {
deleteItem(5512, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(5514)) {
deleteItem(5514, 1);
}
if (playerHasItem(6570)) {
keep6570 = true;
deleteItem(6570, 1);
}
if (!isSkulled) {
keepItemHandle();
}
if (ProtItem) {
applyProtectItemProt();
}
for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
try {
if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 11999) { // createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
replaceBarrows();
// server.checkPlayerCapes.checkDrop(this);
ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
// createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY,
// playerItemsN[i]);
deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]);

            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
        }
    }
    for (int r = 0; r < playerEquipment.length; r++) {
        try {
            int item = playerEquipment[r];
            if ((item > 0) && (item < 11999)) {
                remove(item, r);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sM("ERROR: Removing Equipment");
        }
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5509)) {
        deleteItem(5509, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5510)) {
        deleteItem(5510, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5512)) {
        deleteItem(5512, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(5514)) {
        deleteItem(5514, 1);
    }
    if (playerHasItem(6570)) {
        keep6570 = true;
        deleteItem(6570, 1);
    }
    for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
        try {
            if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 11999) {
                // createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
                replaceBarrows();
                // server.checkPlayerCapes.checkDrop(this);
                ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
                        playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
                // createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY,
                // playerItemsN[i]);
                deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
                        getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
        }
    }
    try {

    } catch (Exception e) {
    }
    ItemHandler.addItem(526, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false);
    try {
    } catch (Exception e) {
    }
    if (itemKept1 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept1, 1);
    if (itemKept2 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept2, 1);
    if (itemKept3 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept3, 1);
    if (itemKept4 > 0)
        addItem(itemKept4, 1);
    if (keep6570) {
        addItem(6570, 1);
        keep6570 = false;
    }

    resetKeepItem();
    hitDiff = 0;
    updateRequired = true;
    appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}[/code]

And add this into boolean process:

if (!IsInFightCave() && !isInPitGame() && !isInPitRoom() && deathStage == 2 && System.currentTimeMillis() - deathTimer >= 2000) { client killerz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[KillerId]; youdied(); killerz.sM("You have defeated " + playerName); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }
